questions.question: Which of the following sorting algorithms has the best average time complexity?
questions.explanation: Merge Sort has an average time complexity of O(n log n), while the others have O(n^2) complexities.

questions.question: What is the primary advantage of linked lists over arrays?
questions.explanation: Linked lists can grow and shrink in size more easily than arrays, which have a fixed size.

questions.question: In a binary search algorithm, what condition must be true for it to be applied?
options: Array must be of fixed size
questions.explanation: Binary search only works on sorted arrays, as it repeatedly divides the search interval in half.

questions.question: Which of the following complexities represents a linear search algorithm?
questions.explanation: A linear search examines each element in the list, resulting in a time complexity of O(n).

questions.question: Supervised learning is a type of machine learning where the model learns from labeled data.
A firewall can prevent unauthorized access to a network.
The 'Isolation' property in ACID ensures that database transactions appear to be executed sequentially.
What is the difference between a process and a thread?
questions.correct_answer: A process is a program in execution, consisting of its own memory space, while a thread is a smaller unit of a process that can be executed independently and shares the same memory space with other threads in the same process.

questions.question: Explain a real-world application of a queue data structure.
questions.correct_answer: Queues are used in print spooling systems where print jobs are lined up for processing in the order they are received.

questions.question: What is NP-completeness in computational theory?
questions.correct_answer: NP-completeness refers to a class of decision problems for which no efficient solution is known, and if a solution can be verified quickly (in polynomial time), it is in 'NP'. If any NP-complete problem can be solved quickly, all problems in NP can also be solved quickly.

questions.question: Which of the following is a core principle of object-oriented programming?
questions.explanation: Inheritance allows classes to inherit properties and behaviors from other classes, fostering code reuse and organization.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of an intrusion detection system (IDS)?
options: To monitor and analyze network traffic
questions.correct_answer: To monitor and analyze network traffic
questions.explanation: An IDS primarily monitors network traffic for suspicious activity and alerts administrators of potential threats.

questions.question: What does the 'Durability' property of ACID guarantee?
options: Data is saved permanently after a transaction commits
No data is lost after a crash
questions.correct_answer: Data is saved permanently after a transaction commits
questions.explanation: Durability ensures that once a transaction has been committed, it remains so, even in the case of a system failure.

questions.question: Which of the following problems is NP-complete?
options: Finding the maximum of a list
Searching for an element in a list
questions.explanation: The Traveling Salesman Problem is NP-complete because no efficient solution is known to find the shortest possible route that visits a set of cities.

questions.question: Bubble sort is more efficient than quick sort for large datasets.
Functional programming emphasizes immutability and first-class functions.
Overfitting occurs when a model performs well on training data but poorly on unseen data.
What is 'feature scaling' in machine learning?
questions.correct_answer: Feature scaling is the method of normalizing or standardizing the range of independent variables or features of data, to improve the performance of machine learning algorithms.

questions.question: What is penetration testing?
questions.correct_answer: Penetration testing is a simulated cyber attack on a computer system or network to evaluate its security and identify vulnerabilities.

questions.question: Explain the difference between a binary tree and a binary search tree.
questions.correct_answer: A binary tree can have any arrangement of nodes, while a binary search tree has specific ordering properties, where for any given node, all values in the left subtree are less, and all values in the right subtree are greater.

questions.question: What is the purpose of paging in memory management?
options: To allow efficient use of memory
questions.correct_answer: To allow efficient use of memory
questions.explanation: Paging divides memory into fixed-size blocks to manage memory allocation efficiently, thereby reducing fragmentation.

questions.question: Which algorithm is primarily used to find the shortest path in a weighted graph?
questions.explanation: Dijkstra's algorithm efficiently finds the shortest paths between nodes in a weighted graph.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the time complexity of an algorithm that performs linear search?
questions.explanation: Linear search examines each element until it finds the target or reaches the end, resulting in O(n) complexity.

questions.question: An AVL tree is a self-balancing binary search tree.
What are functional dependencies in database normalization?
questions.correct_answer: Functional dependencies are a relationship that exists when one attribute uniquely determines another attribute, crucial for determining the normalization level of a database.
